name: Spirit of Scotland Travelpass (4 in 8 or 8 in 15 days)
description:
SPIRIT OF SCOTLAND TRAVELPASS Unlimited travel with weekday time restrictions for either any 4 days in 8 days or any 8 days in 15 days. The area includes the whole of Scotland and extends as far south as 
      Carlisle and Berwick-upon-Tweed in England and includes Edinburgh Trams and the Glasgow Subway. It is also valid on the seated portion of the Caledonian Sleeper from Glasgow to Fort William. It can also be used on bus and coach services on selected routes including Argyll, Skye, the Borders and Northern Highlands, with Scottish Citylink, Stagecoach and 
      West Coast Motors. The ticket is also valid on the Glasgow Subway, just present your Spirit of Scotland Travelpass ticket and you will be issued with a valid ticket for the underground. 
      It is also valid on Edinburgh Trams. A 20% discount is available on Northlink ferry services to Orkney and Shetland; 15% off Cruise Loch Lomond; 10% off Sweeneyâs Loch Lomond Cruises; 
      and 10% off Jacobite Loch Ness Cruises. A 10% discount is available on both the Strathspey Steam Railway and the Keith & Dufftown Railway and £1 off Boâness & Kinneil Railway standard class fares. 
      Other concessions are also available see the Scotrail website for details This ticket is no longer valid on Caledonian-MacBrayne ferry services.

fares_and_restrictions.raw: fares & restrictions New fares from 1st April 2025 Any 4 days in 8 adult: £155.00 child (5-15): £77.50 railcards ⯆ 16 26 SE DI 2T FF H : £103.20 FF child fare: £31.00 Any 8 days in 15 adult: £196.00 child (5-15): £98.00 railcards ⯆ 16 26 SE DI 2T FF H : £130.50 FF child fare: £39.20 Railcards ⯈ Railcards: 16 = 16-25 26 = 26-30 SE = Senior DI = Disabled 2T = Two Together FF = Family & Friends H = HM Forces Previous fares ⯈ Previous fares adult 4 in 8: 2024 - £149.00 adult 4 in 8: 2023 - £149.00 2022 - £149.00 2021 - £149.00 2020 - £149.00 2019 - £149.00 2018 - £139.00 2014 - £134.00 2011 - £121.80 adult 8 in 15: 2024 - £189.00 adult 8 in 15: 2023 - £189.00 2022 - £189.00 2021 - £189.00 2020 - £189.00 2019 - £189.00 2018 - £ 2014 - £179.70 2011 - £163.40 time restrictions Valid after 09:15 Mon to Fri but 2T railcard not valid until 09:30 No restrictions at weekends or public holidays Also valid anytime on the following routes: From Lockerbie to Carlisle and from Lockerbie to Glasgow Central in those directions. Glasgow Queen Street - Oban/Fort William/Mallaig. Glasgow Central - Stranraer. âInverness - Kyle/Wick/Thurso. route restrictions Not valid on "The Jacobite" steam-hauled services between Fort William and Mallaig Not valid between Edinburgh and Glasgow on the Caledonian Sleeper train operating companies Avanti West Coast, CrossCountry, Edinburgh Trams, Glasgow Subway, London North Eastern Railway, ScotRail, Transpennine Express purchasing Online as an M-pass to your smartphone: ✔ Train conductor: ✔ * Station ticket office: ✔ By telephone: ✔ 0344 811 0141 Ticket Vending Machine: i Northern Ticket Vending Machines now sell most ranger and rover tickets but at the moment only for same-day travel (rather prohibitive for distant areas) Some Avanti West Coast station TVMs for example Crewe, now sell local rangers and rovers. LNER TVMs at Doncaster, Edinburgh, London Kings Cross, Newcastle and York also sell them. A number of PTE areas sell local rangers from TVMs in their area e.g. South Yorkshire, Strathclyde and West Midlands * valid ticket to travel is required unless boarded at a station without ticket-issuing facilities
